radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild bibasilar atelectasis in the bases of the lungs; a 4-mm nodule in the right middle lobe; unremarkable liver; normal gallbladder; normal spleen; normal adrenal glands; left kidney demonstrates extrarenal pelvices and hypodensities likely secondary to renal cysts; significant peripancreatic stranding with fluid extending to the inferior splenic pole and diffuse involvement of the pancreas; no pancreatic duct dilatation; unremarkable stomach, duodenum, and small bowel; no retroperitoneal or mesenteric lymphadenopathy; no intra-abdominal free air; no lytic or blastic lesions in the osseous structures.
